techmeme.title: CoreWeave raised $1.5B in its IPO, selling ~37.5M shares at $40 each, down from a planned 49M shares at $47-$55; source: Nvidia anchored with a ~$250M order (CNBC)
How Paul Ginsparg, a Cornell University physics professor, created the digital repository arXiv nearly 35 years ago to help researchers share their preprints (Sheon Han/Wired)
Sources: the EU will impose minimal fines on Apple and Meta next week, far below the DMA's 10% of global turnover cap, to avoid tensions with President Trump (Financial Times)
Taiwan is investigating 11 Chinese tech firms, including SMIC, which is being probed for allegedly poaching engineers to access the island's advanced chip tech (Debby Wu/Bloomberg)
PUBG developer Krafton acquires a "north of 75% stake" in Pune-based gaming studio Nautilus Mobile for $14M in an all-cash deal, its first acquisition in India (Jagmeet Singh/TechCrunch)
